title: [Self-Directed] Evaluation and Application of Explicit Instruction for Students with Mathematics Learning Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and general pedagogical knowledge
context.additional_context: Focus on Evaluating and Developing Improvement Strategies for Mathematics Teaching Methods for Students with Learning Disabilities

learning_goals: Learners can explain core elements of explicit instruction (direct instruction, systematic practice, feedback provision, etc.) with over 80% accuracy
Learners can analyze practical cases using a checklist that evaluates the application level of explicit instruction in mathematics programs
Based on assessment results, learners can propose at least three improvement plans to enhance mathematical achievement for students with learning disabilities

resources: Explicit Instruction Teaching Method Evaluation Guide

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
